alert.note: Alert for Los Angeles; Ventura (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued December 30 at 12:45AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PST EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding caused by moderate to locally heavy rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southwest California, including eastern Ventura County and the coast, valleys, and mountains of Los Angeles County. * WHEN...Until 500 AM PST. * IMPACTS...Moderate to locally heavy rainfall could trigger shallow debris flows in and near recent wildfire burn scars. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1238 AM PST, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated moderate to locally heavy rain falling across the area. Rainfall rates as high as 0.25 to 0.50 inch per hour have been observed. The heaviest rainfall is currently falling over western Los Angeles County. Minor flooding of roadways is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pacific Palisades, Malibu, Reseda, Encino, Northridge, Chatsworth, Van Nuys, Long Beach, Simi Valley, Griffith Park, Burbank, Pasadena, Universal City, Downtown Los Angeles, Hollywood, Alhambra, North Hollywood, Mount Wilson, Beverly Hills, Culver City, and Inglewood. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Move away from recently burned areas if it is safe to do so. The rain may trigger shallow mud and debris flows, minor rock falls, and flooding capable of localized damage, especially in steep terrain in and near burn scars. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely.
